title: How powerful is Percy Jackson? - Quora

response.answer_text: On a scale of 1–10 in demigod standards, he's a 10. On a scale of 1–10 in god standards, he's still a 10. Why? Well it's really no question when it comes to the MOST powerful demigod to have ever lived. If you don't think it's Percy, you're just kidding yourself. If you disagree, feel free to comment on this answer and we can debate ;) I believe I've already said this in a different post, but the reason Percy is so strong is probably not for the reason you might think. Sure Percy is the best swordfighter in 300 years, and he has a lot of cool and strong powers (including water manipulation, breathing underwater, creating hurricanes, etc), but what makes him so powerful is the fact that his emotional state dictates the intensity of his abilities. The biggest example is when Percy killed the minotaur the first time. The minotaur is actually a pretty high class monster in Greek mythology, and Percy Jackson was able to slay it barehanded, at age 12, and with no demigod training whatsoever. But the sole reason he was able to do it was because it had “killed” his mother first. He was so angry that his powers kicked in involuntarily, and that's even true throughout the series. The first time he created his hurricane was when Hyperion threatened the safety of Annabeth and Grover. He entered and left the underworld (something very few heroes have ever done) just to save his mom. He slaughtered the arai to save Annabeth, regardless of the painful curses inflicted on him. And (my favorite) when he held Arachne (probably couple hundred pounds), Annabeth, and himself over Tartarus with one hand. ONE HAND. You see when Percy gets angry, he gets ANGRY. Even when he's chill he's a total savage, but if someone he loves is on the table, I wish you good luck. Alone, Percy could probably take out any one of the Olympians. If for some reason (I've said this before too) Olympus struck down Annabeth…well they don't stand a chance. Elysium knows what Percy Jackson would do, but either way the gods would be no better off than the Lord of Time himself.

As a son of Poseidon, the god of the seas, earthquakes, and horses, Percy Jackson has tremendous potential. Many Percy Jackson fans fantasize about Percy being more powerful that Zeus or something like that. However, while Canon Percy is powerful, he does have his limits. Nevertheless, his power is taken seriously by both Gods and Demigods alike. Hephaestus “Not that powerful, eh? Could have fooled me. You’re the son of the Earthshaker, lad. You don’t know your own strength.” Grover Underwood "It's just my luck. I'm the lamest satyr ever, and I find the two most powerful half-bloods of the century, Thalia and Percy." The Gods also view Percy as being too dangerous “…The next child of the Big Three who reaches sixteen will be a dangerous weapon.” Dionysus “’This boy is still dangerous” Athena “As we know from the Great Prophecy, children of the three elder gods… such as Thalia and Percy… are dangerous” Kronos “Luke feared you… Hazel “But she knew Nico was more dangerous than Reyna, or Octavian, or maybe even Jason. Then she’d met Percy. At first, when she saw him stumbling up the highway with the old lady in his arms, Hazel had thought he might be a god in disguise. Even though he was beat up, dirty, and stooped with exhaustion, he’d had an aura of power” Reyna “The point is, Percy, you are the real power on this quest. You are a seasoned veteran. I’ve seen what you can do. A son of Neptune wouldn’t be my first choice, but if you return successfully from this mission, the legion might be saved. The praetorship will be yours for the taking. Together, you and I could expand the power of Rome. We could raise an army and find the Doors of Death, crush Gaea’s forces once and for all. You would find me a very helpful…friend.” Hazel Percy had seemed so intimidating and powerful, like a real hero. Nico also had very high hopes of Percy surviving Tartarus. And this was after he mentioned how he and no other demigod stood a chance at surviving the Pit. “It’s impossible. I’m the son of Hades, and even I barely survived. Gaea’s forces overwhelmed me instantly. They’re so powerful down there…no demigod would stand a chance. I almost went insane.” “It’s impossible to describe how powerful that place is. Once you get close, it sucks you in. I never stood a chance.” But he says this about Percy. “Percy is the most powerful demigod I’ve ever met. No offense to you guys, but it’s true. If anybody can survive, he will, especially if he’s got Annabeth at his side. They’re going to find a way through Tartarus.” Leo Percy had been intimidating enough before – summoning hurricanes, duelling pirates, killing giants in the Colosseum … Now … well, after what happened in Tartarus, it seemed like Percy had graduated to a totally different level of butt-kickery. More than even the god Tartarus himself, Annabeth feared evil Percy. Since she’d come back from Tartarus, Annabeth had told Piper a lot of scary things that had happened down there. At the top of her list: Percy controlling a tide of poison and suffocating the goddess Akhlys. This is very much in contrast to how Percy himself feels about his capabilities. They depended on him and relied on his powers. Even the Romans had raised him on a shield and made him praetor, and he’d only known them for a couple of weeks. But Percy didn’t feel powerful. The more heroic stuff he did, the more he realized how limited he was. He felt like a fraud. I’m not as great as you think, he wanted to warn his friends.
